WorkItem.Description: I am about to develop an invitation system for membership. Any suggestions are welcome.

Comments.Message: That's a nice idea... what are the 'specs'. I guess what I am asking is how will it work?

Just a thought:

Are you considering "preformatted" membership. Sometimes I think the whole procedure of registering is a mountain people sometimes don't want to climb.You could perhaps invite people with default properties for address and a simple Username and Password. (Hoping once they are overwhelmed by the content of the site they can then update their membership).
Basically,The admin and/or the site users (members) will send e-mails (with a link for confirmation) to their friend, whom they want to be member of the Club Site.
That's a nice idea... do you need TFS access?
Plaid, is this going in any time soon?

Are you trying to do a gmail invitation only sort of thing, or just trying to keep out who you don't think belongs?

I have the problem with the second.  What I did was make everyone who joins not active, fire off an email to myself to login and change them to active if they belong.  I have had the suggestion to add a "password" that would be needed to be able to join.  I don't know if I am going to do that yet, as I don't see a point.  Right now my site has 4 or 5 members.  Come August, it will have 60-70, and that is where it will stay.
Perhaps you can add a tan invitation. So you are able to send your friend an url like www.example.com/invite/tan.aspx?tan=12345 over a messenger or something else.
I'm going to close this... if anyone has a specific implementation, open up a new work item.
